page.title: 19DEEPING ST.JAMES SUGAR BEET
page.content: Sugar beet is a common crop in East Anglia.Many farmers in our area grow it.It is sown in March using a beet drill drawn by a tractor.It takes about six weeks for the first signs of the beet to appear.When the crop is young it is sprayed with Beternol which gets rid of the little insects and weeds which will endanger the crop.The farmers used to hire women to weed the field when it needed it but now they mainly use a normal tractor which has an attachment to pull up the weeds. The sugar beet has a yellow body and green leaves.It is harvested by machine between October and December. The beet is mainly sentto Spalding sugar beet factory where the beet is processed.The farmers can buy the pulp back for cattle feed.
